name: Mountain Chalet Motels

reviews.text: We stayed here for one night as part of a driving holiday around NZ. When we arrived, they had no record of our booking (even though we had written confirmation of the booking made through our agent together with another 10 hotels on this trip - and had no problems at any of the others) but they thankfully had an available chalet for us.
reviews.title: Convenient for Mount Cook and other sightseeing but very very cold

reviews.text: The chalet was clean and had good cooking facilities. The temperature in there however was freezing. There was an air conditioning unit which provided a small amount of heat, together with a small oil filled portable radiator, but these weren't enough to bring the room up to an acceptable temperature. My husband is used to camping etc. but even he slept in 2 jumpers and socks over his pyjamas!
reviews.title: Excellent stop while in transit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There's a lovely, lovely view from the chalets of the surrounding mountains, and staying in Twizel is much better than staying in Mount Cook village itself (about 30 minutes drive away) - but if I was staying there in autumn/winter again, I'd go elsewhere.
reviews.title: Great launch point to Mt. Cook

likes.disliked: — Birds running on the roof at dawn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The property has about 25 self contained chalets of different sizes. Ours had a full size cooker, large bathroom and separate bedroom. It was very good value.
reviews.title: Great base for exploring the area

reviews.text: It was a short walk to the small shopping mall which had several restaurants.
reviews.title: Large, well equipped unit in pleasant grounds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in Twizel to allow us to get to Mount Cook early the following day, so had no real expectations of the accomodation, The chalets were well maintained, with a separate kitchenette (this was the only motel we stayed where the kitchenette was in a separate room) and bathroom.
reviews.title: Perfect for a stop-over

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, there seemed very little to do in Twizel and even finding a place to eat was difficult, as the place we were recommended by the motel owner was actually closed.
reviews.title: Perfect Lodging Enroute To Mount Cook

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Apparently a newly built establishment, Mountain Chalet Motels is located right on the brink of Twizel and you should see it once you turn off Highway 8.
reviews.title: We can tell all our criends we stayed in a castle now

reviews.text: We arrived rather late in the evening and the very friendly owner was kind enough to give us a discount off the normal rate. For NZD 105, we got ourselves an extremely comfortable and spacious chalet which contains a living room, a dining area, full kitchen with all the amenities, large wardrobe, bathroom and a bedroom with 1 double and 1 single bed.
reviews.title: The Pelennor Fields

likes.disliked: — Only spent one night there,not enough.

reviews.title: Cute and cosy chalets
reviews.text: The chalets are clearly web-equipped for all weathers as the multi-split units serves as airconditioning in the heat and heater in the cold, which by the way, would be more often than not since the area is located pretty high up in the mountains.

description: Mountain Chalets is situated in Twizel, 40 minutes’ drive from Mount Cook, on State Highway 8 between Christchurch and Queenstown. This picturesque site is on the doorstep to some of New Zealand’s finest scenery. Located in the Mackenzie Country.
